metadata.title: CVE-2017-16539 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The DefaultLinuxSpec function in oci/defaults.go in Docker Moby through17.03.2-ce does not block /proc/scsi pathnames, which allows attackers totrigger data loss (when certain older Linux kernels are used) by leveragingDocker container access to write a "scsi remove-single-device" line to/proc/scsi/scsi, aka SCSI MICDROP.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16539` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

docker.io - 18.06.1-0ubuntu1~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: docker.io package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '18.06.1-0ubuntu1~18.04.1').
